clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization and Risk Factors of Folliculitis After Hair Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Characterization and Risk Factors of Folliculitis After Hair Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: We retrospectively reviewed 1317 patients who had undergone HT and completed 9-month follow-up between January 2018 and June 2021 at 4 medical centers. The incidence of postoperative folliculitis and the patient demographics were assessed. Logistic regression analysis was used to identify the risk factors, and the characteristics of different types of folliculitis were compared.

detailed_description.textblock: Postoperative folliculitis is a common complication after hair transplantation (HT) and requires effective preventive interventions. This study aimed to characterize postoperative folliculitis and determine the risk factors in patients underwent HT. The study was conducted at 4 clinical sites: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University, the First Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine, the Affiliated Hospital of Guilin Medical University, and Peking University Third Hospital. Data of 1317 patients who had undergone HT and completed a 9-month follow-up from January 2018 to June 2021 were collected. The incidence of postoperative folliculitis and the patient demographics were assessed. Logistic regression analysis was used to identify the risk factors, and the characteristics of different types of folliculitis were compared.

primary_outcome.description: patients present folliculitis after hair transplantation

arm_group.description: Patients presented folliculitis in surgical-area lesions after hair transplantation within 9-month follow up.
Patients didn't present folliculitis in surgical-area lesions after hair transplantation within 9-month follow up.

study_pop.textblock: Data of 1317 patients who had undergone HT and completed a 9-month follow-up from January 2018 to June 2021 were collected.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Healthy adults between the ages of 18 ~ 60
2. patients suitable for autologous hair transplantation according to "the standard of hair transplantation"
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Coagulation disorders, pregnancy and lactation, immunosuppression
2. With severe mental and psychological illness, impairment of body image
3. All kinds of immune-related alopecia in the progressive active stage
4. Patients judged by the investigator to be unsuitable for this study

overall_official.affiliation: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

facility.name: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University
